summary: Norwood-based Analog Devices is acquiring Maxim Integrated in an all-stock deal valued at approximately $20 billion, creating a combined company worth about $68 billion. This acquisition aims to strengthen Analog Devices' position in the analog semiconductor sector and enhance its role in technologies for 5G networks and self-piloted vehicles. Maxim shareholders will receive 0.630 shares of Analog common stock for each Maxim share, with the deal expected to close next summer pending shareholder and regulatory approvals.

title: Analog Devices to scoop up Maxim Integrated in $21B chip deal
summary: Analog Devices is set to acquire San Jose-based Maxim Integrated in a $21 billion chip deal. Analog Devices, based in Massachusetts with operations in Santa Clara, is paying a 22% premium for Maxim Integrated. The acquisition expands Analog Devices' presence in the semiconductor industry.

title: NortonLifeLock hires former eBay exec as new CFO
summary: NortonLifeLock has appointed Natalie Derse, a former eBay executive with over 20 years of experience, as its new Chief Financial Officer. The Tempe-based company announced the hiring following prior news of layoffs impacting over 200 employees in several states and the renaming of its consumer business from Symantec after the Broadcom deal.

title: Electron Rocket's 13th Launch Failed, Destroying its Satellite Payload
summary: Rocket Lab's 13th Electron rocket launch, named "Pics Or It Didn't Happen," failed the past weekend (July 5th) due to an anomaly causing the second stage to explode, destroying its satellite payload. The mission carried payloads for Canon Electronics, Planet, and In-Space Missions. Rocket Lab is investigating the cause with the FAA and plans a rapid return to flight after corrective actions are identified.

title: Excellent Growth of RF Components Market 2020: Comprehensive Study by Top Key Players (ST, NXP, Broadcom, Skyworks Solutions, Murata, TDK, Texas Instruments) | Forecast to 2025
summary: The RF Components Market is projected for excellent growth through 2025, driven by increasing demand for wireless connectivity in smart devices and advancements in communication technologies and materials. A report by Business Industry Reports details the market overview, key players, growth factors, and segmented analysis,

title: Rocket Lab channels SpaceX-like rapid launch capability in July 4 Electron mission
summary: Rocket Lab is aiming for SpaceX-like rapid launch capabilities with its Electron rocket, targeting its shortest turnaround time between missions from the same launch pad. The company is preparing for its second launch in three weeks, the "Pics Or It Didn’t Happen" mission, carrying several small satellites for Earth-imaging. Rocket Lab is also expanding its launch infrastructure and exploring booster recovery technology to further enhance its rapid launch goals.

title: Teardown: Velar infotainment master controller
summary: This article provides a teardown analysis of the Velar infotainment master controller, designed for Jaguar Land Rover vehicles. It details the various electronic components from companies like Intel, Microchip, and Broadcom, highlighting the continuous increase in automotive electronics. The analysis includes a list of key components found on the main PCB, embedded compute module, Ethernet switch PCB, and BT/WLAN module.

title: WastedLocker: Symantec Identifies Wave of Attacks Against U.S. Organizations
summary: Symantec identified a wave of WastedLocker ransomware attacks targeting U.S. organizations, including eight Fortune 500 companies. The attacks utilized the SocGholish framework, masquerading as software updates, and the Cobalt Strike commodity malware to gain network access and deploy the ransomware. Symantec's proactive detection and outreach helped disrupt these attacks, which could have led to significant financial damages and operational disruptions.

title: Extreme Networks Rewires Its Supply Chain
summary: Extreme Networks revamped its supply chain processes through automation and centralization to manage rapid growth from acquisitions and mitigate external disruptions like tariffs and COVID-19. By implementing a vendor-managed inventory (VMI) system and consolidating warehouses, the company significantly reduced product constraints and distribution center costs while improving customer request date performance. This strategic overhaul allowed Extreme Networks to absorb increased transaction volumes and maintain stable inventory levels despite substantial revenue growth.

title: Electronic Products Market 2020 Analysis by Global
summary: This article provides an analysis of the global electronic products market in 2020, identifying key manufacturers such as Samsung Electronics, Intel, and Micron Technology. It highlights Asia Pacific as the largest market region and discusses factors driving growth, including the rising demand for smart TVs. The report also addresses the impact of COVID-19 and offers insights into market size, growth rates, and regional segmentation until 2030.

title: HCL extends partnership with Broadcom; part of the team to transition to HCL
summary: HCL Technologies has expanded its partnership with Broadcom Inc. to include Symantec Enterprise Division (SED) consulting services. As part of this extended agreement, the majority of Broadcom's Symantec enterprise consulting team, specializing in various security aspects, will transition to HCL. This move aims to enhance HCL's cybersecurity offerings and strengthen support for Broadcom customers.

title: Why Intel is betting its chips on microprocessor mastermind Jim Keller
summary: This article profiles Jim Keller, a legendary microprocessor designer who has worked for Apple, Tesla, and AMD, and is now tasked with revitalizing Intel's chip-design enterprise. It explores his unconventional career path, his philosophy of simplification and learning, and the significant impact his designs have had on the tech industry, including the Ryzen chips for AMD and the Autopilot chip for Tesla. The piece details how Intel is relying on Keller to overcome its recent struggles and regain its market leadership.

title: COVID-19 Impact and Recovery Analysis | Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) Market 2020-2024 | Demand for High Memory GPU to Boost Growth | Technavio
summary: Technavio projects the Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) market to grow by USD 38.28 billion between 2020 and 2024, with a CAGR exceeding 29%. This growth is primarily driven by the increasing demand for high-memory GPUs, coupled with the expansion of the PC gaming and gaming console markets. The report provides an in-depth analysis of market trends, vendor landscapes, and the impact of COVID-19, segmenting the market by device type and geography.

title: Nvidia to acquire Sequoia-backed networking startup Cumulus Networks
summary: Nvidia Corp. announced its agreement to acquire Cumulus Networks Inc., a data center networking startup backed by $129 million in funding. This acquisition follows Nvidia's $6.9 billion acquisition of Mellanox Technologies Ltd., as Cumulus software is a key component for some Mellanox products. The deal aims to give Nvidia control over a critical software component and align Cumulus' feature development roadmap with its own goals, optimizing the integration of software and hardware.

title: Accenture Completes Acquisition of Broadcom’s Symantec Cyber Security Services Business
summary: Accenture (NYSE: ACN) has completed its acquisition of the Symantec Cyber Security Services business from Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ: AVGO). This acquisition significantly enhances Accenture Security’s position as a leading provider of managed security services globally, boosting its capabilities in anticipating, detecting, and responding to cyber threats. The acquired business includes over 300 employees and serves a diverse range of industries.

title: Intel To Sell Home Gateway Assets For $150 Million
summary: Intel is selling the majority of its Home Gateway Platform Division assets, including SoC products for home gateways, Wi-Fi access points, and Ethernet, to MaxLinear for $150 million in cash. This sale reflects Intel's ongoing strategy under CEO Bob Swan to consolidate connectivity solutions that are not part of its core business, while still prioritizing other connectivity initiatives like Wi-Fi 6 and 5G. MaxLinear will integrate Intel's employees and technology to expand its offerings in the connected home market.

title: Broadcom Asserts Patents Covering ‘Crucial Aspects’ of Netflix Content Delivery
summary: Broadcom Corporation has filed a patent infringement lawsuit against Netflix, Inc. in the Central District of California, alleging that Netflix's streaming service infringes on nine of Broadcom's U.S. patents. The patents cover technologies crucial for reliable content delivery, efficient server use, and video encoding. Broadcom claims Netflix's infringement has harmed its set-top box business by drawing consumers away from cable television.

title: Key Takeaways: The 2020 Gartner Market Guide for Network Performance Monitoring and Diagnostics
summary: This article highlights key takeaways from the 2020 Gartner Market Guide for Network Performance Monitoring and Diagnostics (NPMD), outlining Gartner's definition of the market and the impact of new dynamic network architectures. It discusses how hybrid environments, the alignment of network and security operations, and major shifts like cloud migration and increasing virtualization are affecting NPMD tools and buyer decisions. Gartner predicts that 50% of network operations teams will rearchitect their monitoring stack by 2024 due to hybrid networking and lists notable network monitoring tool providers.

title: Broadcom withdraws 2020 revenue forecast on coronavirus worries
summary: Broadcom Inc. has withdrawn its revenue forecast for 2020 due to demand and supply disruptions caused by the coronavirus outbreak, joining other chipmakers in revising their outlooks. Despite a slowdown in demand, the company stated its supply chain was not meaningfully impacted. Broadcom expects second-quarter revenue of approximately $5.7 billion, lower than analysts' average estimates.

title: Waymo gets US$2.25 billion from investors to power self-driving expansion
summary: Self-driving car company Waymo has raised US$2.25 billion in its first external funding round to fuel its global expansion. The capital came from a diverse group of investors including Silver Lake, Canada Pension Plan Investment Board, and Mubadala Investment, alongside its parent company Alphabet Inc. This funding will support the deployment of the Waymo Driver worldwide, as the company competes in the rapidly evolving autonomous driving market.

title: Apple, Broadcom Told to Pay Caltech $1.1B in Patent Lawsuit
summary: A federal jury has ordered Apple Inc. and Broadcom Inc. to pay $1.1 billion to the California Institute of Technology for infringing on Wi-Fi data transmission patents. The lawsuit focused on Broadcom's computer chips, which were used in various Apple devices including iPhones and iPads, with both companies' headquarters located in California. Caltech expressed satisfaction with the decision, while Apple and Broadcom did not immediately comment.

title: Voting Gets Lazy; Cash-Craving Comcast; Broadcom Bites the Apple
summary: This article discusses several market topics, starting with the potential for smartphone voting and its implications for democracy. It then analyzes Comcast's strategy to offset video subscriber losses with price hikes and new streaming services, Intel's strong quarterly performance, and Broadcom's significant supply deal with Apple. Finally, it questions the market's enthusiastic reaction to American Express's latest earnings report and offers advice on navigating uncertain market conditions.

title: Broadcom touts $15B in Apple deals as it seeks buyer for one of its businesses
summary: Broadcom has announced $15 billion in deals to supply Apple with chips, while simultaneously seeking a buyer for its radio frequency chip business. Companies like Qorvo and Skyworks are potential candidates to acquire Broadcom's RF chip operations. This strategic move highlights Broadcom's significant partnership with Apple alongside its efforts to divest certain business units.

title: Apple, Broadcom Strike $15 Billion Worth of Chip-Supply Deals
summary: Broadcom Inc. has signed new multiyear agreements with Apple Inc. to supply high-performance wireless components and modules for Apple devices through mid-2023. These new pacts, combined with a similar agreement from 2019, are expected to generate approximately $15 billion in revenue for Broadcom. The chipmaker will supply these components for various Apple products.

title: 10 things I learned from the 2019 Inari AGM
summary: This article details 10 key takeaways from Inari Amertron Berhad's 2019 Annual General Meeting, covering financial performance, expansion plans, strategic partnerships, and future outlook. It highlights the company's revenue and profit decline in FY2019, the completion of its new P34 plant, and management's strategies for growth amidst industry changes like 5G and fluctuating demand for smartphones. The article also touches on Inari's capital expenditure for 2020 and its competitive position in the OSAT industry.

title: Accenture to Acquire Symantec’s Cyber Security Services Business from Broadcom
summary: Accenture announced its agreement to acquire Symantec’s Cyber Security Services business from Broadcom, Inc. This acquisition will position Accenture Security as a leading provider of managed security services, enhancing its ability to detect and respond to cyber threats globally. The deal includes Symantec’s global threat monitoring, real-time threat intelligence, and incident response services, supported by over 300 employees and six security operations centers worldwide.

title: Broadcom quietly acquired a small cyber analytics software company
summary: Broadcom has reportedly acquired cyber analytics software company Bay Dynamics, a move that expands its security business. The acquisition, revealed through regulatory documents, occurred earlier this month. This step aligns with Broadcom's ongoing strategy to build out its security offerings.

title: Cisco to acquire Exablaze for high-performance switching
summary: Cisco plans to acquire Australia-based Exablaze, a manufacturer of high-performance switches and network interface cards used in high-frequency trading and computing. This acquisition mirrors rival Arista's purchase of Metamako and aims to leverage Exablaze's FPGA technology for future AI and machine learning applications. Cisco expects to complete the acquisition by April 2020 and sees it as a move into ultralow-latency switching, complementing its recent Silicon One ASIC announcement.

title: Here are the best-performing stocks of the decade
summary: This article highlights the top-performing stocks of the decade, with Netflix leading the pack with a 3,726.2% return. Other significant performers include semiconductor companies Broadcom and Nvidia, electronic bond trading platform MarketAxess, and Domino's Pizza, which experienced a remarkable turnaround. The article also touches on other companies like Neurocrine Biosciences, Exact Sciences, Cheniere Energy, and DexCom, emphasizing themes of disruption, technological innovation, and strategic business changes that fueled these impressive gains over the last ten years.

title: Broadcom outlook for 2020 gives hope for chip-earnings rebound, stock gains
summary: Broadcom Inc. shares rose after its fiscal fourth-quarter earnings report, which included a 2020 revenue outlook that surpassed Wall Street estimates. The chip maker anticipates fiscal 2020 revenue between $24.5 billion and $25.5 billion, exceeding analysts' forecasts of $23.9 billion. This positive outlook suggests a potential rebound in chip-related earnings, providing a boost to the stock.

title: Israeli Court Rejects Regulator Bid for Additional Taxation of Broadcom's Dune Networks Acquisition
summary: Israel's central district court rejected a demand by the Israeli Tax Authority for Broadcom Inc. to pay an additional $29 million in tax related to its 2009 acquisition of Dune Networks. The authority claimed Broadcom emptied Dune of its assets, which the court disagreed with. Broadcom is reportedly facing a similar situation regarding another acquisition.

title: Report: McAfee mulls possible merger with NortonLifeLock
summary: McAfee LLC is reportedly considering a merger or "combination" with NortonLifeLock Inc., which would unite the two cybersecurity competitors. This potential deal comes after NortonLifeLock spun off from Symantec Corp. and is seeking to eliminate costs, while McAfee itself is also exploring an outright sale. A merger would make sense in a consolidating consumer cybersecurity market driven by mobile app usage and increased trust in platform security from tech giants.

title: 3 networking startups rearchitect routing
summary: Three networking startups, Arrcus, DriveNets, and Volta Networks, are redefining routing by decoupling software from hardware, enabling it to run on commodity products. This disaggregation reduces operational expenses and adds flexibility, mirroring a trend previously seen in network switching. Industry analysts anticipate these companies could become M&A targets as service providers increasingly look towards white box routing for 5G deployments.

title: Kulicke & Soffa Appoints Jeff Richardson to Its Board of Directors
summary: Kulicke & Soffa Industries, Inc. announced the appointment of David Jeffrey Richardson to its Board of Directors. Mr. Richardson brings over 32 years of semiconductor industry experience, previously serving as Chairman of Lattice Semiconductor Corporation and a Director of Ambarella, as well as holding key roles at LSI Corporation and Intel Corporation. The company believes his extensive management and technical background will be invaluable as K&S diversifies and grows.

title: OMAP processors settlement clears way for German car manufacturers
summary: A global patent dispute over OMAP processors between Innovative Foundry Technologies, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC), and United Microelectronics Corporation (UMC) has concluded with a settlement. This resolution offers relief to car manufacturers like VW and Ford, who use infotainment modules containing these chips. The lawsuits primarily targeted chip manufacturers TSMC and UMC, with Texas Instruments also playing a significant role in facilitating the settlement, particularly regarding UMC's processors used in automotive infotainment systems.

title: NortonLifeLock, formerly Symantec, names Vincent Pilette its new CEO
summary: NortonLifeLock, the consumer cybersecurity division formerly known as Symantec, has appointed Vincent Pilette as its new CEO following Broadcom's acquisition of Symantec's enterprise business. Pilette announced plans to eliminate $1.3 billion in costs and expand growth initiatives, including the Norton 360 security suite and international expansion, after the company reported strong financial results that beat Wall Street forecasts. This move focuses on repositioning NortonLifeLock as a pure-play consumer cyber safety company.

title: Goodbye, Symantec: Consumer business gets rebrand
authors: J. Jennings Moss By Marlize van Romburgh
summary: Broadcom Inc.'s $10.7 billion acquisition of Symantec Corp.'s enterprise security business has closed, granting Broadcom the rights to the Symantec name. As a result, the remaining part of Mountain View-based Symantec, specifically its consumer business, has undergone a rebranding. This change means the Symantec brand will now be associated with Broadcom's enterprise security offerings while the consumer segment operates under a new identity.

title: Symantec is now NortonLifeLock as Broadcom closes purchase of its enterprise business
summary: Symantec Corp. has officially changed its name to NortonLifeLock Inc. following the completion of Broadcom Inc.'s $10.7 billion acquisition of its enterprise security business. Symantec’s stock symbol shifted from SYMC to NLOK, and shares in the newly named company rose, with analysts issuing a "buy" rating. This acquisition further consolidates Broadcom's move into the software sector, adding significant cybersecurity services and a new revenue stream.

title: What's driving the Automotive Electronics Market trends? 2024
summary: The automotive electronics market is projected to exceed USD 400 billion by 2024, driven by increasing demand for advanced safety, comfort features, and the development of intelligent vehicle technologies. Stringent regulations, rising electric vehicle sales, and growth in ADAS systems are key factors fueling this expansion. Major players like Lear Corporation, Panasonic, and Continental are investing in R&D to develop advanced electronic systems.

title: Industrial Sector Moves Higher While Stocks Rally Back From Lows
summary: The industrial sector is showing signs of strength despite a broader market downturn led by tech stocks and Netflix. While the Industrial Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLI) has underperformed the S&P 500, the Invesco S&P 500 Equal Weight Industrials ETF (RGI) has outperformed significantly, largely due to Boeing's impact on XLI and better performance from domestically focused industrials and transport stocks. The semiconductor sector, hitting new highs, is also noted as a key leading indicator for market direction.

title: Broadcom is Title Sponsor of the IRIS National Fair
summary: Broadcom Inc. announced its title sponsorship with IRIS (Initiative for Research and Innovation in STEM) to bolster STEM education in India, aiming to impact 4.5 million students. This partnership supports young Indian innovators, provides a platform for them to showcase projects, and underwrites Team India's participation in the ISEF 2020. The collaboration highlights Broadcom's commitment to corporate social responsibility by fostering the next generation of scientists and engineers.

title: What’s Changed: the 2019 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Access Management
summary: Gartner's 2019 Magic Quadrant for Access Management highlights the increasing importance of SaaS delivery, UEBA, and MFA in access management solutions. The report evaluates 14 providers, noting significant movements among visionaries and leaders while identifying key trends and capabilities expected to shape the AM market in the coming years.

title: Cover Story: Electrical + electronics moving up the value chain
summary: This article discusses Malaysia's electrical and electronics (E&E) sector, highlighting its historical development and the current challenge of moving up the value chain from manufacturing to design and development. It explores the reasons behind this struggle, including a shortage of entrepreneurial engineers and issues with the local ecosystem, and proposes solutions such as government support for local design firms and incentives for high-skill workers. The importance of intellectual property ownership and the risks of remaining in low-margin manufacturing are also emphasized.

title: Apple’s US job footprint grows to 2.4 million
summary: Apple's US job footprint has expanded to 2.4 million, an increase of four times the number of American jobs attributable to the company eight years prior. The company is on track to directly contribute $350 billion to the US economy by 2023, while also supporting numerous American suppliers and fostering growth in the app economy. This growth includes significant expansion plans, such as creating 20,000 new jobs across the US by 2023 and opening new facilities in San Diego and Seattle.

title: The Gartner 2019 Magic Quadrant for Unified Endpoint Management Tools
summary: This article discusses Gartner's 2019 Magic Quadrant for Unified Endpoint Management Tools, defining UEM and highlighting key capabilities and trends. It analyzes the positioning of various vendors, noting shifts in Challengers, Niche Players, Visionaries, and particularly the rise of Citrix to the Leaders quadrant, alongside MobileIron, BlackBerry, IBM, Microsoft, and VMware. The report emphasizes the increasing importance of CMT integration and the evolving UEM market.

title: Broadcom to Buy Symantec Enterprise Division
summary: Broadcom has agreed to acquire Symantec's enterprise division for $10.7 billion in cash, marking its second major software acquisition after CA Technologies. This deal will refocus Symantec on its consumer products and aims to generate $2 billion in sustainable revenue for Broadcom, along with $1.3 billion in EBITDA. Symantec plans to return $8.2 billion after taxes to shareholders via a special dividend of $12 a share.

title: Week In Review: Manufacturing, Test
summary: This article provides an overview of developments in the manufacturing and test sectors, highlighting new tools for 3D NAND production, financial results from KLA, and key partnerships and acquisitions in the silicon carbide and semiconductor industries. It also touches on market research for IC products and the competitive landscape between Intel and Samsung.

title: Broadcom to buy Symantec enterprise security business for $10.7 billion
summary: Broadcom has officially announced its acquisition of Symantec's enterprise security business for $10.7 billion. This announcement came shortly after Symantec reported better-than-expected earnings for its fiscal first quarter. Both Symantec and Broadcom saw their stock prices rise following the news.

title: C-suite shuffle: Synaptics taps former Finisar, Broadcom exec as its new CEO, while former chief exec heads to AMD
summary: Synaptics, a San Jose-based company, has appointed the former CEO of Finisar as its new chief executive. Concurrently, Synaptics' previous CEO, Rick Bergman, is transitioning to Sunnyvale-based AMD to lead its largest business segment. This move highlights a significant leadership change for both technology companies.

title: Skype for Business Online 3PIP IP Phones will work with Microsoft Teams until July 31st 2023
summary: Microsoft announced that 3rd Party IP (3PIP) phones certified for Skype for Business Online will continue to function with Microsoft Teams, albeit with limited functionality, until July 31, 2023. An update released on August 3, 2020, extended this support beyond 2023. This article clarifies the implications for users migrating from Skype for Business Online or Server who use these devices, noting that this applies to 3PIP phones and not newer Microsoft Teams IP Phones.

title: Intel (INTC) Q2 2019 earnings preview
summary: Intel is expected to report a decline in Q2 2019 earnings and revenue, with analysts forecasting a 13% drop in EPS and a 7.5% drop in revenue. Investors will be keenly watching the company's guidance for the third quarter and the second half of 2019 after a weaker-than-expected 2019 outlook previously hit the stock. Recent reports indicate an easing of Intel CPU shortages, which alongside new product plans for AI, 5G, and autonomous driving, and long-term revenue targets, will also be of interest.

title: IBM mainframes face competitive pressures inside and out
summary: IBM's mainframe business is facing increasing competitive pressure from cloud-based solutions and even its own Power servers, despite strong legacy customer loyalty. While IBM continues to invest in mainframe modernization, analysts debate its long-term strategic emphasis given the company's focus on cloud, analytics, and other distributed platforms. The article highlights migrations of mainframe workloads to the cloud by companies like Swisscom and Sabre Corp, and discusses the challenges of cost, agility, and skills shortages affecting mainframe adoption, alongside IBM's efforts to innovate and maintain market relevance.

title: Symantec shares jump on Broadcom buyout rumors
summary: Shares of Mountain View-based Symantec rose significantly due to rumors of a potential buyout by Broadcom. The company has faced challenges including increased competition, waning interest in consumer products, and executive leadership changes, with three CEOs since 2016. This comes as Broadcom is reportedly shifting its merger and acquisition strategy away from strictly chip companies.

title: Broadcom's Symantec Play Goes Too Far
summary: This article discusses Broadcom's strategy of acquiring older technology companies and pruning them for value, a strategy typically employed by private equity firms. The author, Shira Ovide, suggests that Broadcom's move to apply this blueprint to software companies like Symantec risks damaging its reputation. The piece questions whether extending this approach beyond hardware into the software sector might prove to be an overreach for the company.

title: Hewlett-Packard and Fort Collins grew up together, but they've also grown apart
summary: This article details the evolving relationship between Hewlett-Packard (HP) and Fort Collins, Colorado, over four decades. While HP was once the city's largest employer and a significant community partner, its presence has diminished since the 2015 split into HP Inc. and Hewlett Packard Enterprise, leading to a reduced workforce and a less visible community role. Despite these changes, both companies continue to contribute to the city through philanthropy and job creation, and their legacy has fostered an entrepreneurial spirit in Fort Collins.

title: Opinion: Broadcom slaps down hopes for a second-half rebound in chips
summary: Broadcom Inc. has dampened expectations for a semiconductor market rebound this year, largely due to sanctions on Huawei Technologies Co. and trade-related customer jitters. The company lowered its guidance and anticipates a 10% drop in revenue for its semiconductor-solutions business for the full year. This outlook suggests a challenging environment for the chip industry's second half.

title: Opinion: Broadcom slaps down hopes for a second-half rebound in chips
summary: Broadcom Inc. has dampened expectations for a semiconductor market recovery in the latter half of the year, attributing this to U.S. sanctions on Huawei Technologies Co. and general trade-related jitters among customers. The company revised its full-year guidance, projecting a 10% drop in revenue for its semiconductor-solutions business. This outlook suggests a challenging environment for the chip industry due to geopolitical tensions.

title: Opinion: Broadcom slaps down hopes for a second-half rebound in chips
summary: Broadcom Inc. has dampened expectations for a significant recovery in the semiconductor market this year, attributing the slowdown to sanctions on Huawei Technologies Co. and trade tensions. The company revised its guidance downward after reporting second-quarter earnings, now expecting its semiconductor-solutions business revenue to drop about 10% for the full year. This signals a "very, very nervous" demand environment for chips.

title: Broadcom results to provide clear insight into trade war impact
summary: Broadcom's upcoming earnings report is expected to offer crucial insights into the impact of the U.S.-China trade war on the semiconductor industry, especially given its significant ties to China and key customers like Huawei and Apple. Analysts are closely watching for commentary on second-half revenue recovery, cloud capital expenditures, and smartphone unit trends, as expectations for the company's performance have recently been lowered. Despite the trade tensions, some analysts view Broadcom's stock as attractive due to its strong long-term growth and profitability prospects.

title: CrowdStrike IPO: 5 things to know about the cybersecurity unicorn
Three Factors Reshaping RF Transceivers in the 5G Era
summary: RF transceivers are undergoing a significant transformation in the 5G era, driven by the need for wider bandwidths, higher integration, and miniaturization. Key semiconductor players like Analog Devices Inc., MaxLinear, and Texas Instruments are developing single-chip solutions that combine multiple functionalities and reduce size and power consumption. These advancements are crucial for supporting the demanding requirements of 5G infrastructure, including massive MIMO and beamforming.

title: How to test 5G: From millimeter-wave to massive MIMO to beamforming
summary: This article explains the essential technologies behind 5G networks, including millimeter-wave, massive MIMO, and beamforming. It details the challenges and testing methodologies for each technology, such as using handheld analyzers for mmWave path loss and over-the-air measurements for phased array antennas. The piece emphasizes the importance of robust testing equipment and adaptation to evolving 5G standards.

title: We learn more about Huawei's Google ban from memes than recent news reports
summary: Google is withdrawing the licensing of the Android Operating System to Huawei's devices, prompting panic amongst Huawei users despite a temporary reprieve. Huawei states it is prepared with stockpiled components, while the internet has reacted with an array of memes humorously theorizing about the implications of the ban. These memes reflect the market situation, the company's difficult period, and the timeline of events leading up to the blacklisting.

title: Google, Qualcomm, Intel, and Broadcom all cut ties with Huawei
summary: Google revoked Huawei’s Android license, and American chipmakers like Intel, Qualcomm, and Broadcom announced they would stop selling components to the Chinese smartphone giant following a U.S. executive order banning American companies from supplying Huawei. This move is a major escalation in the U.S.-China trade war, potentially crippling Huawei's smartphone sales and delaying China's 5G network build. Analysts warn of potential retaliation from China against American tech companies operating within the country.

title: ECONOMY: San Diego Is a Clear Winner as Qualcomm’s Stock Surges
summary: Qualcomm's stock surged by $26 billion in market cap following its settlement with Apple, signaling a major win for San Diego. The deal is expected to lead to increased hiring in the region, with the company's strong local presence and economic impact benefiting the entire economy. Qualcomm's prior economic impact included 10,030 employees directly and an additional 17,850 jobs supported indirectly.

title: South Korea to Launch World's First National 5G Networks
summary: South Korea is launching the world's first nationwide 5G mobile networks, marking a significant technological advancement. This move positions South Korea at the forefront of a global race for 5G dominance, which is expected to transform various industries and daily life, despite ongoing geopolitical tensions, particularly between the US and China, regarding the control of this technology. The rollout includes new 5G-enabled smartphones from Samsung and LG, though cost may initially be a barrier for consumers.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: FTI Consulting adds Rodolfo Araujo as senior managing director in Washington, DC
summary: FTI Consulting has appointed Rodolfo Araujo as a senior managing director in its strategic communications segment in Washington, D.C. Araujo, an expert in corporate governance, proxy contests, and M&A, will lead the Americas corporate governance and activism offering and join the firm's activism and M&A solutions practice. He brings nearly a decade of experience from Institutional Shareholder Solutions (ISS) and Sands Capital, where he specialized in analyzing equity markets and advising on high-profile corporate events for major clients.

title: Cert. Denied – Patent Owners Still Must Prove Unpatented Features Did Not Drive Consumer Purchasing to Rely on EMVR
summary: The Supreme Court denied Power Integrations, Inc.'s petition for certiorari, upholding a high burden for patentees relying on the Entire Market Value Rule (EMVR). This means patent owners must prove that unpatented features of an infringing product did not solely drive consumer purchasing decisions to justify damages based on the product's entire market value. The Federal Circuit had previously vacated a $138M damages award to Power Integrations, stating insufficient evidence to invoke the EMVR.

title: Nvidia to buy Mellanox for $6.9 billion as it pushes into data centers
summary: Nvidia has agreed to acquire chipmaker Mellanox Technologies Ltd. for $6.9 billion, a move aimed at bolstering its presence in the expanding data center market. The acquisition is Nvidia's largest ever and seeks to accelerate its successful initiatives in providing graphics chips for artificial intelligence work in data centers. The deal signals a potential resumption of consolidation within the semiconductor industry, despite concerns about regulatory approvals amid the U.S.-China trade war.

title: Automotive Electronics Control Unit (ECU) Market 2019-2024
summary: The Automotive Electronics Control Unit (ECU) Market is experiencing significant growth, driven by advancements in autonomous vehicle technology, increasing demand for electric and hybrid vehicles, and the need for sophisticated control units for enhanced vehicle safety and performance. North America and Asia Pacific are key growth regions, with market value projected to reach USD 95 billion by 2024. Key industry players include Texas Instruments, Lear Corporation, Infineon Technologies, Broadcom Inc., Panasonic, Continental, Delphi, Johnson Controls, and ZF Friedrichshafen.

title: India Threatens to Send One of Its Billionaires to Jail
summary: India's top court has warned billionaire Anil Ambani that he faces jail time unless his company, RCom, pays its dues to Ericsson. This development is part of a larger dispute that has led to his mobile-phone carrier entering bankruptcy proceedings and highlights India's significant problem with bad debt.

title: Ex-Broadcom CEO Henry Nicholas Charged With Drug Trafficking
summary: Former Broadcom Inc. CEO Henry Nicholas has been charged with drug trafficking by Las Vegas prosecutors. Nicholas and a companion were arrested last summer at the Wynn Encore after police discovered a variety of narcotics in their villa. A criminal complaint alleges five counts of drug trafficking and two counts of drug possession.

title: 10 Things You Didn’t Know about Broadcom CEO Hock E. Tan
summary: This article details 10 lesser-known facts about Broadcom CEO Hock E. Tan, covering his background, education, career progression through mergers and acquisitions, and philanthropic efforts. It highlights his origin in Malaysia, impressive academic achievements at MIT and Harvard, and his role in the formation of Broadcom Inc.

title: Broadcom execs: Here's how the CA acquisition works
summary: Broadcom executives explain their strategies for integrating the CA Technologies acquisition, emphasizing complementary portfolios and the long-term viability of mainframe software. Despite skepticism from analysts regarding the $18.9 billion deal for a 40-year-old software company, Broadcom believes its direct engagement with large corporate accounts and flexible licensing will secure CA's existing mainframe customer base. The article also addresses concerns about Broadcom's acquisition history and commitment to CA's core products.

title: Automotive-grade sensor supports both proximity and ambient light detection
summary: Vishay Intertechnology's optoelectronics group has released a new automotive-grade proximity and ambient light sensor, the Vishay Semiconductors VCNL4030X01. This fully integrated sensor features Filtron technology and a 16-bit ADC in a compact surface-mount package. It supports applications like touch-screen locking, display activation, dimming control, and collision avoidance, offering design flexibility and power-saving programmable interrupt functions.

title: Pfizer and GlaxoSmithKline combine consumer health care businesses
summary: Pfizer and GlaxoSmithKline have announced a merger of their consumer health product divisions into a joint venture, with GSK holding a 68% stake. This deal creates the largest consumer health business globally, with combined 2017 sales of $12.7 billion. The move allows GSK to focus on pharmaceuticals and vaccines, while Pfizer continues to shed its consumer product businesses to concentrate on its core pharmaceutical operations.

title: Automotive Electronics Control Unit (ECU) Market 2018
summary: The Automotive Electronics Control Unit (ECU) Market is projected to exceed USD 95 billion by 2024, driven by increasing demand for safety features, electric vehicles, and advanced features in luxury cars. Passenger vehicles are expected to show significant growth, and the market is segmented by regional companies including Altera, Broadcom Inc., Infineon Technologies, and Continental. Key growth drivers include rising demand for electric and autonomous vehicles, technological advancements, and stricter safety standards globally.

title: Broadcom Inc. and HCL Technologies Announce a Global Preferred Services Partnership
summary: Broadcom Inc. and HCL Technologies have announced a global preferred services partnership, making HCL the preferred services partner for Broadcom's enterprise software products. HCL will provide professional services, education, and training, with many of Broadcom's professional services personnel transitioning to HCL. This partnership aims to leverage HCL's expertise in Digital and IT Infrastructure to support customer's mission-critical software and create a new Center of Excellence for Broadcom enterprise software products.

title: Thoma Bravo to Acquire Veracode Software from Broadcom Inc. for $950 Million in Cash
summary: Thoma Bravo, a private equity firm, announced its agreement to acquire Veracode, an application security testing provider, from Broadcom Inc. for $950 million in cash. The acquisition is expected to boost Veracode's market reach and innovation in application security, with Sam King becoming CEO upon closing. This move underscores the growing importance of software security in the digital economy.

title: Thoma Bravo to Acquire Veracode Software from Broadcom Inc. (NASDAQ:AVGO)
summary: Thoma Bravo announced its agreement to acquire Veracode, an application security testing provider, from Broadcom Inc. for $950 million in cash. This acquisition aims to create a leading independent cybersecurity company, enhancing Veracode's market reach and innovation in application security. The partnership is expected to support Veracode's future operational and product development plans given Thoma Bravo's extensive experience in the cybersecurity software sector.

title: Broadcom Closes Acquisition Of CA Technologies
summary: Broadcom Inc. announced the completion of its acquisition of CA Technologies. As a result, CA's common stock will no longer be traded on NASDAQ, and it will operate as a wholly owned subsidiary of Broadcom. Broadcom views this acquisition as a stable market opportunity, emphasizing the continued importance of mainframes in enterprise computing.

title: How Cisco 400 GbE switches compare with Arista's
summary: Cisco has introduced its first 400 GbE switches, entering a competitive market alongside rivals Arista and Juniper Networks. The article compares Cisco's new Nexus 400 GbE switches with Arista's offerings, highlighting differences in merchant silicon, optical connectors, and backward compatibility. Key distinctions include Cisco's likely use of Innovium's Teralynx silicon versus Arista's Broadcom Tomahawk 3 chip, and their approaches to optical module compatibility and port density.

title: Paul Weiss Scores Lead Role on IBM’s $33B Red Hat Buy
summary: Paul Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison secured the lead M&A and finance counsel role for IBM's $33.4 billion acquisition of Red Hat Inc., marking the largest software company acquisition ever. This deal highlights the significant impact of Scott Barshay, who joined Paul Weiss from Cravath in 2016 and previously advised IBM on numerous transactions. Hogan Lovells is handling antitrust matters for IBM, while Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom is advising Red Hat, and Debevoise & Plimpton is representing financial advisers Guggenheim Partners LLC and Morgan Stanley & Co. LLC.

title: Broadcom Achieves Mass Production on Industry-Leading 12.8 Tbps Tomahawk® 3 Ethernet Switch Family
summary: Broadcom Inc. announced that its StrataXGS® Tomahawk® 3 switch series has achieved production release, enabling high-volume deployment of Ethernet network equipment with market-leading 12.8 Terabits/sec performance. This series is the first production-qualified silicon family to support high-density 400GbE, 200GbE, 100GbE, and 50GbE interconnect, significantly reducing cost and power per port. The Tomahawk 3 has already been adopted by major cloud service providers for their scale-out data center fabrics.

title: Gallium Nitride (GaN) Semiconductor Device Market will be Valued at 29.2 Billion USD globally by 2025 - Cree, Samsung, Infineon, Qorvo, MACOM, Microsemi, Analog Devices, Mitsubishi Electric, GaN Systems, Exagan, VisIC Technologies
summary: The Global Gallium Nitride (GaN) Semiconductor Device Market is projected to reach USD 29.2 Billion by 2025, growing at a healthy rate from 2018 to 2025 with a CAGR of more than 6.2% over the forecast period 2017-2025. This growth is driven by increasing use of electronic appliances, demand for radio frequency in power electronics, and rising use of electric vehicles. Key market players include Cree, Samsung, Infineon, and others.

title: Broadcom Extends Automotive Ethernet Leadership with New Innovative Gigabit-capable PHY, Secure Switch and Smart Camera MCU
summary: Broadcom has announced new automotive Ethernet solutions, including a gigabit-capable PHY, a secure switch, and a smart camera MCU, enhancing its portfolio for advanced in-vehicle networks. These innovations aim to support next-generation automotive data and safety requirements, improving network security, performance, and functionality for applications like ADAS and infotainment. The new products address increasing demand for high-bandwidth and secure connectivity within vehicles.

title: Micron Technology shares slip after CFO says Trump's tariffs will hit business and issues disappointing outlook
summary: Micron Technology shares fell after its CFO stated that new 10% tariffs on Chinese imports would impact gross margins and issued a disappointing outlook for fiscal first-quarter earnings and revenue, despite strong fourth-quarter results. The tariffs represent a significant challenge for Micron, which relies heavily on revenue from China. Analysts have also cooled on the stock due to anticipated price cuts and waning demand for memory chips.

title: Samsung Selected To Supply 5G NR Solution by SK Telecom
summary: Samsung Electronics announced that it has been selected by SK Telecom to supply 5G solutions, including core and RAN, compliant with the 5G New Radio (NR) standard. The companies will begin commercial 5G deployments in October 2018 using Non-Standalone (NSA) architecture. This partnership continues their long-standing collaboration on 5G development, including a world-first interworking of 4G LTE and 5G NR in 2017.

title: Broadcom Profit Surges as Enterprise Storage Business Grows
summary: Broadcom reported a significant surge in its third-quarter profit, reaching $1.2 billion, more than double the previous year, marking its sixth consecutive quarter of such growth. Following the announcement, the company plans to substantially increase shareholder payouts. CEO Hock Tan defended the controversial acquisition of software company CA Inc., calling it a "big doorway" to a "new and huge opportunity."

title: Broadcom acquires CA Technologies in $18bn deal
summary: Broadcom Inc. is set to acquire CA Technologies for approximately $18.9 billion in an all-cash transaction. This acquisition aims to expand Broadcom's infrastructure technology leadership, enter the fragmented infrastructure software market, and provide significant recurring revenue. The deal, which has been approved by both companies' boards and has the support of CA Technologies' major shareholder, is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2018, subject to shareholder and antitrust approvals.

title: Arista Buys Some Wi-Fi to Boost its 'Mojo'
summary: Arista Networks acquired Wi-Fi pure-play Mojo Networks, a move that initially seemed curious given Arista's data center focus. However, the acquisition makes sense as Arista seeks to leverage Mojo's data and cloud management capabilities to expand its CloudVision platform and addressable markets, particularly the increasingly critical Wi-Fi edge. While Arista doesn't aim to compete directly with existing Wi-Fi vendors for access point business, the integration of Mojo's cognitive Wi-Fi into Arista's cognitive networking strategy presents significant opportunities for data aggregation, analytics, and automation in high-value networking.

title: Qualcomm plans huge stock buyback after ditching NXP bid: report
summary: Qualcomm Inc. is reportedly abandoning its bid to acquire NXP Semiconductors NV due to resistance from Chinese regulators. Instead, Qualcomm plans to propose a stock buyback plan, adding $10 billion to its existing program. This announcement is expected to coincide with Qualcomm's earnings release after the market close.

title: Qualcomm Scraps $44 Billion NXP Deal After China Inaction (Published 2018)
summary: Qualcomm canceled its $44 billion acquisition of NXP Semiconductors due to the absence of regulatory approval from China, amidst escalating trade tensions between the U.S. and China. NXP will receive a $2 billion termination fee from Qualcomm, which in turn plans to buy back up to $30 billion of its stock. This failure occurred despite approvals from eight other jurisdictions, highlighting China's use of the deal as leverage in trade negotiations.

title: Chipmaker Broadcom inks $19 billion deal to buy software company CA
summary: Broadcom Inc. announced an $18.9 billion deal to acquire U.S. business software company CA Inc., marking a significant venture beyond its core semiconductor business. This acquisition comes after U.S. President Donald Trump blocked Broadcom's hostile bid for Qualcomm, and the deal has surprised Wall Street due to the apparent lack of immediate synergies between the chipmaker and the mainframe software specialist. Broadcom aims to capitalize on CA's recurring revenue and mission-critical technology, financing the deal with cash and $18 billion in new debt.

title: Broadcom loses $19-billion in market value after surprise bid to buy software company CA
summary: Broadcom's surprise $18.9 billion bid to acquire software company CA Inc. resulted in a $19 billion loss in its market value, as investors and analysts expressed strong concerns regarding the lack of strategic synergies with its core semiconductor business. Despite some analysts viewing it as a potential long-term masterstroke by CEO Hock Tan to diversify into infrastructure software, the deal led to a significant stock downgrade and skepticism about its immediate financial rationale. Broadcom, known for growth through acquisitions, aims to leverage CA's cash flow and its own cost-cutting expertise to build a new software platform.

title: Broadcom Agrees to Buy CA Technologies for $19 Billion
summary: Broadcom Inc. has agreed to acquire CA Technologies for approximately $19 billion, diversifying its business by expanding into software. This deal, valued at $18.9 billion or $44.50 per share, marks the semiconductor maker's return to mergers and acquisitions following the previous attempt to acquire Qualcomm.

title: Broadcom agrees to buy CA Technologies for $18.9 billion
summary: Broadcom Inc., a semiconductor maker, has agreed to acquire CA Technologies for $18.9 billion in cash, diversifying its business into corporate software. The deal, which offers a 20% premium to CA's closing price, is expected to immediately add to Broadcom's earnings. This move follows Broadcom's blocked hostile takeover bid for Qualcomm and signifies its expansion into infrastructure software solutions.

title: Broadcom reaches deal to acquire CA Technologies for $18.9 billion in cash
summary: Broadcom has announced an agreement to acquire CA Technologies for $18.9 billion in cash, representing a strategic move for Broadcom following its failed bid for Qualcomm. The deal values CA stock at $44.50 per share, a 20 percent premium, and is expected to close in the fourth calendar quarter of 2018, subject to shareholder and antitrust approvals. This acquisition aims to diversify Broadcom and build one of the world's leading infrastructure technology companies.

title: Broadcom to buy software company CA Technologies for $18.9 billion
summary: Broadcom announced its agreement to acquire enterprise technology company CA Technologies for $18.9 billion in cash, valuing CA stock at $44.50 per share. This acquisition aims to diversify Broadcom and follows its unsuccessful bid for Qualcomm, with both company boards approving the deal. Shares of CA Technologies surged over 16 percent in extended trading following the news, while Broadcom's shares edged down more than 5 percent.

title: STMicroelectronics’ New Precision MEMS Sensor Supports Accurate Positioning and Control for Cars
summary: STMicroelectronics has launched the automotive-grade ASM330LHH six-axis inertial sensor designed for high-resolution motion tracking in advanced vehicle navigation and telematics. This sensor enables precise positioning even when satellite signals are blocked, supporting automated services and advanced automated-driving systems. Magneti Marelli has already chosen the ASM330LHH for upcoming vehicle models.

title: Why Broadcom Inc (NASDAQ:AVGO) Stock Is a Top Pick for Income Investors
summary: This article examines why Broadcom Inc (NASDAQ:AVGO) is considered a top pick for dividend investors. It delves into various factors that make the semiconductor company an attractive investment for those seeking income. The article highlights reasons why AVGO stock is a compelling choice for investors focusing on dividends.

title: Nomura Downgrades Intel After CEO Resignation
summary: Nomura Instinet downgraded shares of Intel Corp. (INTC) to neutral from buy and lowered its price target to $55 from $60 following the abrupt resignation of CEO Brian Krzanich. The downgrade reflects concerns over the lack of leadership and increasing uncertainty about Intel's long-term outlook, especially regarding the succession plan and ongoing struggles with chip manufacturing technology. Intel's stock was down 2.5% in early trading, despite a 14% year-to-date gain.

title: New Arista switches use Barefoot Tofino programmable chip
summary: Arista has launched its 7170 series of switches, which are equipped with the Barefoot Networks Tofino programmable packet processor. These new switches are designed to consolidate functions typically handled by network appliances and routers, aiming to reduce costs and network complexity for large enterprises, cloud, and communication service providers. The programmability is enabled by P4, an open-source language, and Arista provides application profiles for various network functions.

title: NetApp Announces AFF A800, ONTAP 9.4, & New Cloud Services
summary: NetApp has announced significant updates including the new AFF A800 all-flash array, ONTAP 9.4, and new intelligent cloud services such as NetApp Cloud Volumes for Google Cloud Platform. These advancements aim to support high-performance AI and ML workloads, offering end-to-end NVMe capabilities and enhanced hybrid cloud data management. The company is also partnering with NVIDIA and Broadcom to further strengthen its offerings in AI and Fibre Channel compatibility.

title: Che Lai Chang: Embrace Change for Greater Cross-Border Opportunities
summary: Che Lai Chang, Senior Vice President at East West Bank, discusses how U.S.-China partnerships are thriving despite trade tensions, with a focus on cross-border opportunities for middle-market companies. She highlights the growing Chinese middle class and China's "Made in China 2025" plan as key drivers for continued investment and collaboration. Chang advises U.S. businesses to adopt an open mind and embrace differences to attract Chinese investors and leverage mutual benefits.

title: Qualcomm to lay off a reported 1,500 workers in $1B cost-cutting push
summary: Qualcomm Inc. is laying off approximately 1,500 employees, primarily in California, as part of its commitment to reduce annual expenses by $1 billion. This workforce reduction comes after fending off a hostile takeover bid from Broadcom Ltd. and amidst new challenges, including delays in its acquisition of NXP Semiconductor NV and potential impacts from U.S.-China trade disputes. Qualcomm's shares are down over 4% following these announcements.

title: Why Broadcom Ltd. Wouldn't Buy MediaTek
summary: This article argues against the idea of Broadcom acquiring MediaTek, despite a previous suggestion that it could be an alternative after the blocked Qualcomm deal. The author explains that Broadcom typically buys market leaders or very close seconds, a criterion MediaTek, as a distant second to Qualcomm in mobile application processors, does not meet. Additionally, MediaTek's lower gross profit and operating margins would dilute Broadcom's strong financial performance, making it an unsuitable acquisition target for Broadcom's strategic goals.

title: Qualcomm begins layoffs as part of cost cuts
summary: Qualcomm Inc has started laying off employees as part of its commitment to investors to cut annual costs by $1 billion. The chipmaker stated that a workforce reduction is necessary to support long-term growth, despite first evaluating non-headcount expense reductions. This move follows an earlier announcement in January to save $1 billion in annual costs, partly as an attempt to counter a hostile bid from Broadcom Inc.

title: JPMorgan U.S. Quality Factor ETF ETF Price, Holdings, & News (NYSEARCA:JQUA)
summary: The JPMorgan U.S. Quality Factor ETF (JQUA) is an exchange-traded fund that tracks the JP Morgan US Quality Factor index, focusing on profitability, earnings, and solvency from the Russell 1000 companies. JQUA was launched on November 8, 2017, and is managed by JPMorgan Chase, with holdings including major tech companies like Alphabet, Broadcom, and Apple. The ETF has performed well, with its stock increasing by 10.6% this year to $63.34 as of the latest data.

title: Qualcomm to Lay Off an Estimated 1,000 Employees
summary: Qualcomm Inc. is projected to lay off approximately 1,000 employees. This comes after President Trump blocked a $117 billion acquisition bid by Broadcom Ltd, a decision praised by UCSD Chancellor Pradeep Khosla. The layoffs are significant enough to require a Worker Adjustment and Retraining Notification filing in California.

title: Broadcom, Inc. | $AVGO Stock | Shares Rise 4.5% On $12 Billion Share Repurchase Announcement
summary: Broadcom's shares gained 4.5% after the company announced its Board of Directors authorized a $12 billion share repurchase program, set to begin immediately and conclude by November of the following year. This buyback program follows the recent blocking of its acquisition of Qualcomm by President Donald Trump. The company also reported increased revenue and gross margin for Q1 2018, with CEO Tom Krause highlighting the repurchase program as a complement to their capital allocation strategy.

title: Sunlands Technology Group (STG) Stock Price, News & Analysis
summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of Sunlands Technology Group (STG) stock, an online education service provider based in China. It covers key financial metrics, company overview, analyst ratings, earnings, short interest, insider ownership, news headlines, and frequently asked questions about its stock performance. The company specializes in K-12, college entrance exam, and professional qualification test preparation through its digital platform.

title: Why the Technology Industry Opposed the Broadcom–Qualcomm Deal
summary: The technology industry opposed Broadcom's $117 billion bid for Qualcomm due to Broadcom's alleged unethical business practices, including threatening price hikes and pressuring exclusive deals with customers like Western Digital and Amazon. These allegations led to an FTC investigation into Broadcom's anticompetitive behavior. President Trump's intervention ultimately scuttled the acquisition.

title: Broadcom keeps promise to move to US from Singapore, after Trump blocks bid for Qualcomm
summary: Broadcom Inc. has completed its redomiciliation to the United States from Singapore, fulfilling a promise after President Donald Trump blocked its proposed acquisition of Qualcomm Inc. on national security grounds. This move makes Broadcom's San Jose location its sole headquarters. The redomiciliation was approved by shareholders and the Singapore High Court, making the company an American entity despite its previous legal domicile.

title: Broadcom completes move to U.S. from Singapore
summary: Broadcom Inc. has completed its redomiciliation from Singapore to the United States, a move announced weeks after its $117 billion bid for Qualcomm Inc. was blocked on national security grounds. This relocation allows Broadcom to avoid scrutiny from CFIUS for future U.S. acquisitions. The company's shares rose 0.4 percent in after-hours trading following the announcement.

title: NXP Semiconductors sells China JV stake as Qualcomm takeover awaits Beijing nod
summary: NXP Semiconductors has sold its stake in a Chinese chip-design joint venture for $127 million, a move that could potentially help ease competition concerns as Qualcomm's $44 billion takeover of NXP awaits approval by Chinese regulators. This sale reduced NXP's exposure to the Chinese market. An NXP spokesman stated the transaction was part of asset portfolio pruning and not directly related to the acquisition.

title: With Qualcomm saga behind it, Broadcom tops Q4 estimates
summary: Broadcom exceeded its Q4 estimates due to strong demand for its chips from smartphone makers, even after its $117 billion hostile bid for Qualcomm was blocked by US President Donald Trump. The company reported a significant increase in net income, bolstered by its Wi-Fi chip sales and a $5.79 billion gain from the US tax law, while planning to redomicile to the United States and scout for smaller acquisition targets.

title: Qualcomm | $QCOM Stock | Shares Bolt Higher On Buyout Rumors
summary: Shares of Qualcomm ($QCOM) surged in after-hours trading following rumors that former Chairman Paul Jacobs is attempting to acquire the company. This news comes shortly after Broadcom abandoned its own buyout attempt of Qualcomm. Jacobs reportedly needs to amass over $120 billion for the acquisition.

title: Timeline: Broadcom-Qualcomm saga comes to an abrupt end
summary: Broadcom Ltd withdrew its $117 billion bid to acquire Qualcomm Inc after U.S. President Donald Trump blocked the attempt due to national security concerns. This timeline details the key developments in the Broadcom-Qualcomm saga, from Broadcom's initial offer to the eventual withdrawal of the bid and related political interventions. The article highlights the concerns raised by U.S. officials regarding the impact on America's lead in mobile technology and potential Chinese influence.

title: If Broadcom-Qualcomm deal can’t pass Trump’s test, what can?
summary: President Trump blocked Broadcom Ltd.'s takeover attempt of Qualcomm Inc. due to national security concerns. This intervention could significantly deter future foreign deals for U.S. tech companies and American companies' bids for foreign rivals. The blocked merger was poised to be the largest tech merger in history.

title: If Broadcom-Qualcomm deal can’t pass Trump’s test, what can?
summary: President Donald Trump blocked Broadcom Ltd.'s takeover attempt of Qualcomm Inc., citing national security concerns. This intervention could have a significant chilling effect on future foreign deals for U.S. tech companies and American companies' bids for foreign rivals. The blocked merger would have been the largest tech merger in history.

title: How Broadcom vs. Qualcomm went from hostile takeover bid to a Trump blockade
summary: The article details the escalating conflict between Broadcom and Qualcomm, which began as a hostile takeover bid and culminated in President Donald Trump blocking the record-breaking deal. The intervention by the U.S. government heightened the intensity of the battle, transforming a typical corporate fight into a political one. Key events leading up to the blockade included Broadcom's rush to move to the U.S., Qualcomm's executive chairman stepping down, and potential involvement from Intel.

title: In U.S.-China Tech Rivalry, Whose Side Is Qualcomm On?
summary: Qualcomm (QCOM) is at the crux of the escalating tech rivalry between the U.S. and China, its home country and largest market. The Trump administration blocked Broadcom's $117 billion takeover bid for Qualcomm due to national security concerns related to China's advancements in 5G technology, an area where Qualcomm is a key player. Despite being designated a "national champion" by the U.S., Qualcomm faces divided loyalties as it relies heavily on the Chinese market.

title: KDDI & NEC ship world’s first 802.11ax home gateway
summary: KDDI and NEC are set to ship the world's first 802.11ax-enabled home subscriber gateway this month, powered by Qualcomm's Draft Release 802.11ax chipset. This new gateway will offer wireless (PHY) rates up to 6 Gbps and four times better capacity than previous devices, supporting KDDI's 1 Gbps and 10 Gbps fiber-to-the-home broadband. Qualcomm is aggressively pushing Wi-Fi innovation, especially with the upcoming 802.11ax standard, amidst a potential hostile takeover bid from Broadcom.

title: President Trump halts Broadcom takeover of Qualcomm
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump blocked Broadcom Ltd's proposed $117 billion takeover of Qualcomm Inc on national security grounds, citing concerns that it would give China an advantage in mobile communications. The decision stemmed from fears that an acquisition by Singapore-based Broadcom could derail Qualcomm's leadership in 5G technology, potentially benefitting China's Huawei. This marks the fifth time a U.S. president has blocked a deal based on CFIUS objections.

title: Trump blocks Broadcom from buying Qualcomm, citing national security
summary: President Trump blocked Broadcom Ltd.'s proposed $117-billion acquisition of Qualcomm Inc. citing national security concerns. The Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) recommended blocking the deal, fearing it would undermine Qualcomm's leadership in 5G wireless technology and benefit China's Huawei Technologies Co. The decision came after Broadcom had attempted to accelerate its headquarters relocation to the U.S., a move that CFIUS deemed a violation of their order.

title: Qualcomm’s chairman steps down, and Intel reportedly considers acquiring Broadcom
summary: Qualcomm's chairman, Paul Jacobs, has stepped down from his executive role and the board chairmanship, a move aimed at appeasing shareholders amidst a hostile takeover bid from Broadcom. Meanwhile, Intel is reportedly considering acquiring Broadcom to prevent a combined Broadcom-Qualcomm entity from dominating the chipmaking industry. This boardroom shuffle and potential acquisition highlight significant shifts in the competitive landscape of the semiconductor sector.

title: Microchip Takes Over Microsemi for Estimated $8.35Bn
summary: Microchip Technology announced its intent to acquire Microsemi for an estimated $8.35 billion, aiming to strengthen its presence in the military, aerospace, computing, and communications sectors. The deal, which includes a $68.78 per share cash offer, is expected to close in Q2 2018 and immediately add to Microchip's adjusted earnings per share, with projected savings of $300 million by the third year. This acquisition reflects the ongoing merger and acquisition trend within the semiconductor industry.

title: Chip mergers keep on coming: Microchip Technology gobbles up Microsemi for $8.3B
summary: Microchip Technology Inc. has agreed to acquire rival Microsemi Corp. for $8.3 billion in cash, bolstering its presence in the aerospace, defense, communications, and computing sectors. This acquisition is part of a broader consolidation trend within the semiconductor industry, driven by cost-cutting and the pursuit of next-generation computing applications. Analysts suggest this consolidation reflects growing demand outpacing companies' organic R&D capabilities, potentially leading to higher prices for enterprises in the long term.

title: Qualcomm raises offer for NXP Semiconductors
summary: Qualcomm has raised its offer to buy NXP Semiconductors to $127.50 per share from $110, aiming to secure the deal after pressure from shareholders including Elliott Management. This revised bid puts pressure on Broadcom concerning its own offer for Qualcomm and has been backed by key NXP stockholders. The acquisition seeks to expand Qualcomm's presence in the automotive chip market.

title: Qualcomm, Moving to Fend Off Broadcom, Raises Bid for NXP to $44 Billion (Published 2018)
summary: Qualcomm increased its takeover bid for NXP Semiconductors to approximately $44 billion ($127.50 per share) to secure the deal and deter Broadcom's hostile bid for Qualcomm. The revised offer convinced key NXP shareholders, including Elliott Management, to support the acquisition. This move puts pressure on Broadcom, which had previously indicated it would abandon its takeover attempt if Qualcomm's NXP offer exceeded $110 per share.

title: Qualcomm should negotiate sale to Broadcom, says ISS
summary: Proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) has recommended that Qualcomm negotiate a sale to Broadcom following Broadcom's sweetened $121 billion offer. ISS advised Qualcomm shareholders to vote for four of Broadcom's six director nominees at the upcoming shareholder meeting, suggesting this would encourage a negotiated deal despite Qualcomm's previous resistance. While ISS believes Broadcom's current offer isn't clearly superior to Qualcomm's standalone value in the short term, it views the offer as a reasonable starting point for negotiations.

title: Qualcomm Rejects Broadcom Proposal, But Says Open To Further Discussions
summary: Qualcomm Inc. (QCOM) has rejected Broadcom's $82.00 per share proposal, deeming it to materially undervalue the company and carry an unacceptably high level of risk. Despite the rejection, Qualcomm stated its board is open to further discussions with Broadcom to potentially reach a proposal that accurately reflects Qualcomm's true value and ensures deal certainty. Qualcomm expressed concerns about Broadcom's hesitancy to agree to necessary regulatory commitments and its intentions for Qualcomm's licensing business.

title: Qualcomm, Broadcom plan to meet on Feb. 14 - sources
summary: Qualcomm Inc and Broadcom Ltd are scheduled to meet on February 14 to discuss Broadcom's $121 billion acquisition offer, marking their first direct discussion on the potential deal. This meeting follows Broadcom's increased offer and concessions, which Qualcomm still deems an undervaluation and lacking firm regulatory commitments. Both companies are also engaging with proxy advisory firms ahead of a shareholder vote on March 6.

title: Qualcomm rejects Broadcom offer
summary: Qualcomm has rejected Broadcom's revised $121 billion buyout offer, citing "serious deficiencies in value and certainty" while still proposing a meeting to discuss the bid further. Qualcomm believes the $82 per share offer undervalues the company and lacks the necessary regulatory commitment given significant antitrust risks. The company also raised concerns about Broadcom's proposed divestitures and the potential disruption during a critical period of innovation for Qualcomm.

title: Qualcomm Rejects Broadcom’s Revised Buyout Offer (Published 2018)
summary: Qualcomm has unanimously rejected Broadcom's revised $121 billion buyout offer, stating it materially undervalues the company and lacks sufficient regulatory commitment. Despite Broadcom's "best and final" offer of $82 a share and pledges for regulatory resolution, Qualcomm believes the proposal has serious deficiencies in value and certainty. A successful acquisition would represent the largest-ever technology industry takeover.

title: Annual Semiconductor Sales Increase 21.6 Percent, Top $400 Billion for First Time
summary: The global semiconductor industry achieved its highest-ever annual sales in 2017, totaling $412.2 billion, representing a 21.6 percent increase over 2016. This growth was driven by increased demand across various products and emerging technologies, with memory products leading as the largest and fastest-growing category. The Semiconductor Industry Association anticipates continued, albeit more modest, growth in 2018 and urges policymakers to support U.S. innovation and competitiveness.

title: Broadcom Makes 'Best and Final' Bid for Qualcomm in Hostile Takeover Battle
summary: Broadcom has made a "best and final" offer of $82 per share for Qualcomm in their ongoing $130 billion hostile takeover battle. This offer represents a significant premium over Qualcomm's stock price prior to takeover talks. Qualcomm is reviewing the revised proposal, while regulatory scrutiny and Qualcomm's acquisition of NXP Semiconductors remain key factors in the deal.

title: Broadcom to raise $120 billion Qualcomm bid in push for talks: Sources
summary: Broadcom is planning to raise its bid for smartphone chipmaker Qualcomm to approximately $120 billion, aiming to pressure Qualcomm into negotiations before a crucial shareholder meeting on March 6. The new offer would value Qualcomm between $80 and $82 per share, up from the previous $70, and include a higher breakup fee to address regulatory concerns. Meanwhile, Qualcomm is pursuing its own acquisition of NXP Semiconductors NV for $38 billion while also dealing with a patent infringement dispute with Apple.

title: Broadcom Said to Plan $120 Billion Qualcomm Bid, Reuters Says
summary: Broadcom Ltd. is reportedly planning to increase its hostile takeover offer for semiconductor rival Qualcomm Inc. to approximately $120 billion, up from $105 billion. The new bid is expected to be between $80 and $82 per share, a rise from the previous $70. Broadcom advisors are scheduled to finalize the offer details.

title: Xiaomi, Vivo, Oppo protest Broadcom’s $105 billion Qualcomm bid
summary: Three major Chinese smartphone manufacturers, Xiaomi, Oppo, and Vivo, have voiced their opposition to Broadcom's $105 billion bid to acquire Qualcomm. They argue that such a merger would create a monopoly in the smartphone chip market, stifle innovation, and negatively impact research and development in the wireless technology sector. The companies, heavy users of Qualcomm chips, emphasized their support for Qualcomm against Broadcom's unsolicited acquisition attempt.

title: Broadcom's Henry Samueli Connects Success, Philanthropy
summary: Henry Samueli, co-founder and CTO of Broadcom, turned a childhood passion for electronics into a tech empire. He leverages his success through the Samueli Foundation, focusing on STEM education, integrated health, and youth outreach, demonstrating a strong commitment to philanthropy. Samueli will be inducted into the 2018 U.S. News STEM Leadership Hall of Fame for his contributions to technology and society.

title: Apple, Oracle and Microsoft are expected to issue less debt in 2018
summary: Following five years of significant growth in corporate bond issuance, technology companies like Apple Inc., Broadcom Ltd., and Microsoft Corp. are projected to issue less debt in 2018. This shift is primarily due to the expectation that these companies will begin repatriating cash held overseas back to the U.S. after the new tax bill, alleviating the need to issue bonds for shareholder rewards.

title: United Microelectronics aims for AI innovation on a budget
summary: United Microelectronics (UMC) is shifting its focus to artificial intelligence (AI) applications for cars and consumer electronics, moving away from the maturing smartphone market. The company's co-president, SC Chien, stated that UMC plans to prioritize boosting profit in the coming years. This strategic shift aims to innovate within a budget, leveraging emerging AI opportunities.
